description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eoq32","text":"Protocol for processing of LRRK2RCKW bound to GZD-824 and DARPin-E11. This protocol covers everything from preprocessing to refinement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":32,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"te7b","text":"Requires the use of CryoSparc v.4.3.1 and Topaz 0.2.5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"44l19","text":"Use your preferred software. The original publication used MotionCor 2 and CTFFIND4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjlsh","text":"As a note, all of the data processed was collected on a UltrAuFoil Holey Gold 2/2 200 mesh grids and we used CryoSparc v.4.3.1 to process the data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ep42","text":"Blob picker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r7m5","text":"We used cryoSparc-live blob picker option with a minimum particle diameter of 90Å to 250Å, lowpass filter to 20Å. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ad3vk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl9kd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1eq9t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cbjm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87s8i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":22,"style":"sup"}],"key":"eakdh","text":"Depending on the LRRK2RCKW variant, trimer particles might appear, we process them parallel using the following:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aklvt","text":"Monomer particles were picked with a 320pixel box size with a pixel of 0.935Å. This were bin by 4 to a box size of 80pixel with a final pixel size of 3.74Å ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aqmec","text":"Trimer particles were picked with a 400pixel box size with a pixel of 0.935Å. This were bin by 5 to a box size of 80pixel with a final pixel size of 4.68Å. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b86f7","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4dbk1","text":"2D Classification and Topaz picking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fhoh","text":"Using the extracted particles, we run 2D classification jobs in cryoSparc, using 40 iterations to clean our particle dataset. Selected particles then were use to train a Topaz model, and model was used to pick particles, followed by rounds of 2D classification. Selected particles can then be re-extracted to original pixel size (in this case 0.935Å, box size of 320pixel for monomers and 400pixel for dimers)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftmad","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bnq6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8fg7n","text":"Selecting  2D classes depends on the user. Take into account shape of the particles (J-shaped) and the visualization of secondary structure elements. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"209og","text":"Ab-initio reconstruction and Heterogeneous Refinement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e81aq","text":"Select monomer particles then are subject to an Ab-initio reconstruction in cryoSparc asking 3 classes. Followed by a Heteregeneous Refinement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j0oa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2nlb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":149,"style":"bold"}],"key":"c5ltk","text":"In this section you could try more than 3 classes, in order to sort bad particles out. This can be coupled with the final 2D classification jobs from step 3. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"51th0","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jvh5","text":"Nu-Refinement and Local refinement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2260d","text":"Selected refinement from step 4, is subject to a Nu-refinement at C1 symmetry. Followed by a local refinement with a continuous mask surrounding the Kinase, WD40 and DARPin-E11. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f740j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41bl3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e09cs","text":"3D Variability","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dfe8","text":"To account for the hetereogeneity of the ROC-COR domains, create a mask using the Nu-refinement of step 5, and using the same amount of particles of the same job, run a 3DVA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8j6pq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f31ms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4tmq3","text":"Recommendation: use a filter resolution of 7Å, and we ask for 3 components. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65ceg","text":"3D Variability Display","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ofdb","text":"Use this jobs with the output from Step 6, to visualize the movement of the ROC-COR domain. Input the following: for output-mode \"intermidiates\", \"11: frames, and filter resolution of \"7Å\".","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":117,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":147,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":163,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg8h9","text":" To visualize the movement of each component download file to chimera and use volume morph. Select component with the most movement in the ROC-COR domain.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anlcl","text":"Clone 3D Variability Display job and now select: skip reconstruction, only used this component (write which component you picked), and select Intermediates: output particle subsets. The output of this job should be the 11 particles stacks. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":46},{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":141,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82q02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cromd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1al2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"661dh","text":"Local Refinement of the ROC-COR domain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k7ek","text":"Particles of the component obtained from step 6.1, are split in half, selecting the particles that account for the movement of the ROC-COR closest to the Kinase domain.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl640","text":" This are subject to a local refinement. The Nu-refinement volume from step 5 is used as the input for the local refinement, a continuous mask surrounding the ROC-COR domains is created and the selected particles of the component. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":71,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfi68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ptrm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bngrt","text":"Ab-initio and Nu-Refinement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kbo1","text":"Select trimer particles were use to run an Ab-initio reconstruction in cryoSparc. Followed by a Nu-Refinement C1 and at C3 symmetry. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"neat","text":"We compare both the C1 and C3 maps to check for density for the inhibitors in the protomers and overall resolution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19h63","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"633hq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9cepo","text":"In our case, C3 symmetry improved resolution of Kinase active site. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2e7ll","text":"Particle expansion ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vsg6","text":"Particles from Nu-Refinement in step 8 were used for a Symmetry Expansion job in cryoSparc, based on the volume symmetry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4upvl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dhoi","text":"Local Refinement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hvhq","text":"A local refinement was carried using the following inputs:  mask of one protomer of the trimer, expanded particles from step 9, Nu-refinement from step 8 and C1 symmetry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":120,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":147,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Processing of LRRK2-RCKW:GZD-824:E11

creator.name: Amalia Villagran Suarez
creator.affiliation: Department of Cellular and Molecular Medicine, University of California, San Diego, La Jolla, CA 92093
